attributes.action: Add PIMS-TS symptoms to the NHS Covid19 website and to 111 online
attributes.additional_details: PIMS-TS (also known as MISC outside the UK) is hard to diagnose as its symptoms are multiple and mimic other conditions. It is essential that all UK parents are able to easily access symptom information online, so that they can make sense of these diverse symptoms and seek prompt medical assistance. As PIMS-TS is so closely linked to Covid and shares some of its symptoms, symptom information should be placed next to Covid symptoms on the NHS website.
attributes.background: Paediatric Multisystem Inflammatory Syndrome temporally associated with SARS Covid 2 (PIMS-TS) can occur in children 2-6 weeks after contact with Covid. It is an acute illness and requires prompt diagnosis to avoid long term complications. Government symptom information is essential to achieve this.

rejection.details: We can't accept your petition because the UK Government and Parliament aren't responsible for the issue you raise. This is an operational decision for the NHS.
